intro: Ixeridium alpicola, commonly known as the alpine sandwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Ixeridium alpicola thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous environments.
